intro: Glochidion neilgherrense, commonly known as the Nilgiri glochidion, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous minute seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
